1.name: King Kong
1.description: A film crew goes to a tropical island for an exotic location shoot and discovers a colossal ape who takes a shine to their female blonde star. He is then captured and brought back to New York City for public exhibition.

2.name: The Kennel Murder Case
2.description: Philo Vance, accompanied by his prize-losing Scottish terrier, investigates the locked-room murder of a prominent and much-hated collector whose broken Chinese vase provides an important clue.

3.name: Hold Your Man
3.description: A woman is sent to a reformatory when her con artist lover flees after killing a man during a botched blackmail scheme.

4.name: The White Sister
4.description: A young woman falls in love with a dashing officer, but becomes a nun when she believes him to be killed in battle.

5.name: The House on 56th Street
5.description: This movie opens in 1905, when showgirl and daughter of a deceased gambler Peggy Martin falls in love with Monte Van Tyle and breaks the news to lover Fiske that she is leaving him. She and...                See full summary »

6.name: Professional Sweetheart
6.description: A vice-free radio singer wants to experience the dark side of life, so a press agent convinces her sponsor to choose a "professional sweetheart" from her fans.

7.name: Ecstasy
7.description: Eva has just gotten married to an older gentleman, but discovers that he is obsessed with order in his life and doesn't have much room for passion. She becomes despondent and leaves him, ...                See full summary »

8.name: The Invisible Man
8.description: A scientist finds a way of becoming invisible, but in doing so, he becomes murderously insane.

9.name: Berkeley Square
9.description: A young American man comes to believe that he can will himself back to London in the time of the American Revolution and meet his ancestors, who lived in the house he has just inherited.

10.name: Duck Soup
10.description: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

11.name: I Loved a Woman
11.description: Art student John Hayden interrupts his studies in Greece to head his father's meat packing business on his father's death. He marries social climber Martha who taunts him for his ideals ...                See full summary »

12.name: 42nd Street
12.description: A director puts on what may be his last Broadway show and, at the last moment, a naive newcomer has to replace the star.

13.name: Queen Christina
13.description: Queen Christina of Sweden is a popular monarch who is loyal to her country. However, when she falls in love with a Spanish envoy, she must choose between the throne and the man she loves.

14.name: The Testament of Dr. Mabuse
14.description: A new crime wave grips the city and all clues seem to lead to the nefarious Dr. Mabuse, even though he has been imprisoned in a mental asylum for nearly a decade.

15.name: Dinner at Eight
15.description: Affluent Millicent and Oliver Jordan throw a dinner for a handful of wealthy and/or well-born acquaintances, each of whom has much to reveal.

16.name: Sons of the Desert
16.description: When Stan and Ollie trick their wives into thinking that they are taking a medicinal cruise while they're actually going to a convention, the wives find out the truth the hard way.

17.name: Gold Diggers of 1933
17.description: A wealthy composer rescues unemployed Broadway performers with a new play.

18.name: Mystery of the Wax Museum
18.description: The disappearance of people and corpses leads a reporter to a wax museum and a sinister sculptor.

19.name: Baby Face
19.description: A young woman, sexually exploited all her life, decides to turn the tables and exploit the hapless men at a big city bank - by gleefully sleeping her way to the top.

20.name: Alice in Wonderland
20.description: In Victorian England a bored young girl dreams that she has entered a fantasy world called Wonderland populated by even more fantastic characters.

21.name: Design for Living
21.description: A woman cannot decide between two men who love her, and the trio agree to try living together in a platonic friendly relationship.

22.name: The Private Life of Henry VIII.
22.description: King Henry VIII marries five more times after his divorce from his first wife Catherine of Aragon.

23.name: Little Women
23.description: A chronicle of the lives of a group of sisters growing up in nineteenth-century America.

24.name: Footlight Parade
24.description: Chester Kent struggles against time, romance, and a rival's spy to produce spectacular live "prologues" for movie houses.

25.name: Cavalcade
25.description: The triumphs and tragedies of two English families, the upper-crust Marryots and the working-class Bridges, from 1899 to 1933 are portrayed.

26.name: Dancing Lady
26.description: An attractive dancer is rescued from jail by a rich man, who helps her to have her first big opportunity at a musical play on Broadway.

27.name: The Son of Kong
27.description: The men who captured the giant ape King Kong return to Skull Island and find his likewise gigantic but far more friendly son.

28.name: Morning Glory
28.description: When a naively innocent, aspiring actress arrives on the Broadway scene, she is taken under the wing of several theater veterans who mentor her to ultimate success.

29.name: She Done Him Wrong
29.description: In the Gay Nineties, a seductive nightclub singer contends with several suitors, including a jealous escaped convict and a handsome temperance league member.

30.name: Bombshell
30.description: Sexpot film star Lola Burns seeks a new image and tries marrying a marquis and adopting a baby - all sorts of schemes which go awry.

31.name: Flying Down to Rio
31.description: An aviator and band leader who is always getting his group fired for his flirtatious behavior with the female guests soon finds himself falling for an engaged woman.

32.name: Roman Scandals
32.description: A kind-hearted young man is thrown out of his corrupt home town of West Rome, Oklahoma. He falls asleep and dreams that he is back in the days of olden Rome, where he gets mixed up with court intrigue and a murder plot against the Emperor.

33.name: The Vampire Bat
33.description: When corpses drained of blood begin to show up in a European village, vampirism is suspected to be responsible.

34.name: The Ghoul
34.description: An Egyptologist returns from the dead to take revenge on those who have violated his tomb.

35.name: Lady Killer
35.description: A former gangster makes it big in Hollywood, but his old life catches up with him.

36.name: Lady for a Day
36.description: A gangster tries to make Apple Annie, the Times Square apple seller, a lady for a day.

37.name: The Emperor Jones
37.description: Unscrupulously ambitious Brutus Jones escapes from jail after killing a guard and through bluff and bravado finds himself the emperor of a Caribbean island.

38.name: Christopher Strong
38.description: A famous female flier and a member of Parliament drift into a potentially disastrous affair.

39.name: Hijôsen no onna
39.description: A gangster tries to find redemption with the inadvertent help of an innocent shop girl and his jealous girlfriend will do anything to keep him.

40.name: Deluge
40.description: A massive earthquake strikes the United States, which destroys the West Coast and unleashes a massive flood that threatens to destroy the East Coast as well.

41.name: Wild Boys of the Road
41.description: In the depths of the Depression, two teenage boys strike out on their own in order to help their struggling parents and find life on the road tougher than expected.

42.name: Ladies They Talk About
42.description: Attractive Nan, member of a bank-robbery gang, goes to prison thanks to evangelist Dave Slade...who loves her.

43.name: The Working Man
43.description: Successful wealthy shoe manufacturer John Reeves takes a vacation, leaving his business in the hands of his nephew. While on vacation Reeves runs into his rival's heirs, who are living it ...                See full summary »

44.name: The Story of Temple Drake
44.description: A wealthy but neurotic Southern belle finds herself trapped in the hideout of a gang of vicious bootleggers. The gang's leader lusts after her, and is determined not to let anything stand in the way of his having her.

45.name: The Sin of Nora Moran
45.description: Nora Moran, a young woman with a difficult and tragic past, is sentenced to die for a murder that she did not commit. She could easily reveal the truth and save her own life, if only it ...                See full summary »

46.name: The Patriots
46.description: Outskirts is an internationally renowned masterpiece of early sound cinema. In a remote Russian village during World War I, colorful and nuanced characters experience divided loyalties: ...                See full summary »

47.name: The Song of Songs
47.description: Lily falls in love with the sculptor who leaves her out of fear of commitment.

48.name: The Devil's Brother
48.description: Two wannabe bandits join the service of a dashing nobleman, who secretly masquerades as Fra Diavolo, a notorious outlaw.

49.name: Murders in the Zoo
49.description: A monomaniacal zoologist is pathologically jealous of his beautiful but unfaithful wife Evelyn and will not stop short of murder to keep her.

50.name: Whistling in the Dark
50.description: A mystery writer and his sweetheart are held hostage by a fugitive gangster, who hopes to get writer's help in devising the "perfect crime"
